description:
Radiator Springs is the small artificial canyon named for the Disney California Adventure ride in which it is located.

Approach

There are two obvious approaches each with their own challenges. Both approach ridges are narrow and appropriate caution must be taken to avoid falling off either side.

Direct approach

Begin at the picnic tables in Cars Land and walk south to the fence. Follow the fence west to a 10ft ridgeline rock. Climb this rock and then follow the ridge west to a large arch. Using a water balloon slingshot, launch a baseball with a thin cord 45' over the arch and then use that thin cord to pull a rope over the arch. Secure one side of the rope to the ground and ascend the other side to the top of the arch. Follow the ridge line southwest then south to the beginning of the canyon.

Rooftop approach

For those unconcerned with natural aesthetics on approach, begin in the service parking lot south of the canyon. Chimney between the small garage and the Radiator Springs ride building to reach the top of the small garage, then take the staircase up to the roof of the Radiator Springs ride building. Head northeast to some exposed scaffolding facing east and climb it 30' to the top of a ridge. Head west along the ridge to the top of the canyon.

Descent

R1: 29' from tree 10' RDC

R2: 10', possible down climb

R3: 20' from tree RDC

Exit

At the base of R3, walk a few feet to the tramway and wait for the next available shuttle. Shuttles run during the daytime, but do not stop so getting on them may require some ingenuity. Alternately, follow the tramway downhill until you can exit it and head north (crossing the tramway twice more) before reaching the fence at the 10ft climb.

Red tape

Backpacks larger than 24"x15"x18" are not allowed, nor are selfie sticks. Canyoneers shorter than 40" may not use the exit shuttle. There may be other not-specifically-published restrictions on canyoneering in this location.
